channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Risotto raises $10M seed to use AI to make ticketing systems easier to use
item.description: Designed to autonomously resolve help desk tickets, Risotto has raised $10 million in seed funding in a round led by Bonfire Ventures.

item.title: Samsung’s TriFold phone will cost $2,899 in the US
item.description: The phone's display unfolds twice to reveal a 10-inch display, which is the largest screen ever on a Galaxy phone.

item.title: TikTok joins Snap to settle social media addiction lawsuit
item.description: Jury selection begins Tuesday as this case moves closer to trial.

item.title: Airtable gets into the AI agent game with Superagent
item.description: SuperAgent is Airtable's first standalone product in its 13-year history, and signals both the company's ambitions and the reality of the current AI m...

item.title: Pinterest to lay off 15% of staff to redirect resources to AI
item.description: Pinterest says it's "reallocating resources to AI-focused roles and teams that drive AI adoption and execution" and "prioritizing AI‑powered products ...

item.title: Bluesky teases 2026 roadmap: a better Discover feed, real-time features and more
item.description: Bluesky is teasing new features and improvements ranging from the Discover feed to video support.

item.title: Phoebe Gates and Sophia Kianni’s Phia raises $35M to ‘make shopping fun again’
item.description: “We’re on the cusp of a completely new way of shopping,” Gates told TechCrunch.

item.title: Anthropic and OpenAI CEOs condemn ICE violence, praise Trump
item.description: Anthropic's Dario Amodei and OpenAI's Sam Altman spoke out against ICE enforcement tactics following Minneapolis violence, with one addressing concern...

item.title: Anthropic reportedly upped its latest raise to $20B
item.description: Anthropic looks to raise $20 billion at more than $300 billion valuation, according to reports.

item.title: Amazon agrees to pay consumers $309M in returns policy settlement
item.description: The lawsuit, filed in 2023, alleged that Amazon caused "substantial unjustified monetary losses” for consumers who returned an item but were still cha...
